wqtrends 1.0.0

Estimate seasonal rates of change based on average estimates

anlz_trndseason.Rd

Estimate seasonal rates of change based on average estimates

anlz_trndseason(
  moddat = NULL,
  mods = NULL,
  doystr = 1,
  doyend = 364,
  justify = c("left", "right", "center"),
  win = 5,
  ...
)

Arguments

moddat

input raw data, one station and paramater
mods

optional list of model objects
doystr

numeric indicating start Julian day for extracting averages
doyend

numeric indicating ending Julian day for extracting averages
justify

chr string indicating the justification for the trend window
win

numeric indicating number of years to use for the trend window
...

additional arguments passed to other methods

Value

A data frame of slope estimates and p-values for each year

Details

Trends are based on the slope of the fitted linear trend within the window, where the linear trend is estimated using a meta-analysis regression model (from anlz_mixmeta) for the seasonal averages (from anlz_avgseason)

See also

Other analyze: anlz_avgseason(), anlz_backtrans(), anlz_fit(), anlz_gam(), anlz_perchg(), anlz_prdday(), anlz_prd(), anlz_smooth(), anlz_trans()

Examples

library(dplyr)

# fit models with function
tomod <- rawdat %>%
  filter(station %in% 32) %>%
  filter(param %in% 'chl')
if (FALSE) {
anlz_trndseason(tomod, trans = 'log10', doystr = 90, doyend = 180, justify = 'left', win = 5)
}
# use previously fitted list of models
trans <- 'log10'
mods <- list(
  gam0 = anlz_gam(tomod, mod = 'gam0', trans = trans),
  gam1 = anlz_gam(tomod, mod = 'gam1', trans = trans), 
  gam2 = anlz_gam(tomod, mod = 'gam2', trans = trans)
  )
anlz_trndseason(mods = mods, trans = 'log10', doystr = 90, doyend = 180, justify = 'left', win = 5)
